title: Building Scan Patterns
content: A scan pattern is a systematic route through your monitoring points. It ensures nothing gets skipped during routine checks. Good scan patterns start with safety-critical items, include all key parameters, and can be completed in a reasonable time. Random scanning creates gaps; disciplined patterns create completeness.

mcq.question: What's the primary purpose of using a consistent scan pattern?

options.B: It prevents you from skipping critical monitoring points

mcq.explanation: Scan patterns ensure completeness. When you follow the same route consistently, you don't accidentally skip items, especially under stress when attention narrows.
